Description:
TheFirebase Admin Java SDK (v5.0.1)is now available. It includes a bug fix that makes the SDK more stable
when deployed in theApp Engineenvironment. To install
this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.1.1)is now
available. It includes a bugfix for storage default bucket creation.
To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.1.0)is now
available. It includes fixes forAuthentication, as well as support for lazy
initialization of Firebase components. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

Title: Firebase Performance Monitoring - Feature
Description:
The initial public beta release ofFirebase Performance Monitoringis now available for iOS and Android apps.Performance Monitoringlets you gain insight
into your app's performance and network behavior. To learn more about how to
usePerformance Monitoringto improve the quality of your app, seeFirebase Performance Monitoring.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase iOS SDK (v4.0.0)is now
available. It includes the beta release ofPerformance Monitoringbreaking changes in all
Swift SDKs, and updates toAdMob,Analytics,Authentication,Crash Reporting,Realtime Database,Dynamic Links,Cloud MessagingandRemote Config. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase Android SDK (v10.2.6)is now available as part of theGoogle Play services 10.2.6 release.
This release includes the beta release ofPerformance Monitoringand updates to
includingCloud MessagingandTest Lab. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v4.0.0)is
now available. This is a major version change that includes breaking changes:
please review thedetailed release notesto ensure your app functions as expected. This release includes changes to the
overall SDK support, and several changes toAuthenticationincluding the
introduction of phone authentication. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase Admin Python SDK (v2.0.0)is now available. This release migrates the SDK to the newgoogle-authlibrary for credential processing and JSON web token (JWT) validation. To
install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase Admin Java SDK (v5.0.0)is now available. It includes improvements to the credentials API. To install
this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase Admin Node.js SDK (v5.0.0)is now available. It includes improvements to the SDK initialization and user
managements APIs. To install this SDK, seeAdd the Firebase Admin SDK to your Server.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description:
Firebaseconsole now supports multiple logged-in users. Users
can toggle accounts through the account switcher in the top navigation bar.

Title: Crash Reporting - Feature
Description:
Added the ability to see the percentage of users who have not
encountered an error (crash or non-fatal error) in an app over the selected
timeframe to theFirebaseconsole. This is shown in theError-free users panelof theCrash Reportingconsole.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description:
Shorthand names for apps, known as "app nicknames" are now managed
from and visible throughout theFirebaseconsole.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description: Simplified the process of adding service accounts to a project.

Title: Analytics - Changed
Description:
Increased the maximum length of event names and parameter names to
40 characters, and the maximum length of string parameter values to 100
characters.

Title: the Notifications composer - Feature
Description:
Instance ID keys are now available in the Notifications settings
area of theFirebaseconsole.

Title: Google Analytics - Fixed
Description:
Existing users who update to anAnalytics-enabled version of
an app are no longer included infirst_openmetrics. This server-side
correction could cause a drop infirst_openmetrics.

Title: Crash Reporting - Changed
Description:
Firebase Crash Reportinghas now exited beta. To get started
usingCrash Reporting, see theCrash Reportingintroduction.

Title: Firebase Test Lab - Feature
Description:
You can now run several tests per day on both the Spark (free)
and Flame pricing plans. To learn more, seeFirebase Pricing.

Title: Remote Config - Feature
Description:
Added the ability to randomly re-assign app users to new
percentage ranges inUser in random percentilerules. To learn more, seeRemote Config Rule types.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description:
Project owners and editors can now create app "nicknames" that are
displayed throughout theFirebaseconsole alongside the full package name or
bundle ID.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description:
Project owners and editors can now change the reporting currency
for their apps.

Title: Authentication - Feature
Description: Removed the 500 user limit on the Users Table in theFirebaseconsole, and improved search within this table.

Title: Dynamic Links - Feature
Description: You can generate shortDynamic Linksprogrammatically using theLink Shortener REST API.

Title: Dynamic Links - Feature
Description:
You can now enable Android AppLinks by entering a SHA256 checksum
in theFirebaseconsole.

Title: Remote Config - Feature
Description:
Added support for usingGoogle Analyticsuser properties to
create conditions. To learn more, seeRemote Config and user properties.

Title: Test Lab - Changed
Description:
Test Labwill now charge $1 per device hour to test apps on
Android Virtual Devices (AVDs). To learn more about how billing is calculated
for Test Lab, seeTest Lab billing.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v3.4.1)is now
available. It includes updates toRealtime DatabaseandCloud Storage.  To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase Android SDK (v9.6)is now
available as part of theGoogle Play services 9.6 release.
It includes updates toAnalytics,Cloud Messaging,Authentication,Realtime Database, andDynamic Links. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebaseC++SDK (v1.2.0)is
now available. It includes updates toCloud Messaging,Authentication,Remote Config,InvitesandAdMob. To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your C++ Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.6.0)is now
available. It includes updates toAnalytics,Cloud Messaging,Authentication,Realtime Database,Remote Config,Dynamic LinksandAdMob. To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase JavaScript SDK (v3.4.0)is now
available. It includes updates toRealtime Database. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your JavaScript Project.

Title: Dynamic Links - Feature
Description:
You can debug the behavior of longDynamic Linksacross platforms by
adding the following to the end of anyDynamic LinkURL:&d=1.

Title: Dynamic Links - Changed
Description:
When a user clicks aDynamic Linkto an app that is not installed on
their iOS device, thatDynamic Linkwill now open the installation page for that app
in the App Store, unless an iOS fallback link parameter is specified. This is
true whether the user clicked the link in Safari, or in another app.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.5.2)is now
available. To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.5.1)is now
available. To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

Title: Remote Config - Feature
Description: Added the ability to search parameters and conditions from theRemote ConfigParameterstab in theFirebaseconsole.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase iOS SDK (v3.4.0)is now
available. To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your iOS Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebase Android SDK (v9.4)is
now available as part of theGoogle Play services 9.4 release.
To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your Android Project.

Title: SDK Releases - Other
Description:
TheFirebaseC++SDK (v1.1.0)is
now available. To install
this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your C++ Project.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description:
AView Onlyindicator is now displayed at the top of theFirebaseconsole for projects that you have read-only access to. A number
of action buttons have also been updated to be hidden or disabled for users
who do not haveEditororOwnerpermissions for a project.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description:
You can delete apps from projects using a new action button in the
Advanced Options section when managing an app.

Title: Firebaseconsole - Feature
Description: You can edit the name of a project after creating it in theProject Settingsdialog.

Title: Realtime Database - Feature
Description:
You can now view usage metrics in theFirebaseconsole by
clicking on theUsagetab. Firebase currently tracks bandwidth usage,
total storage used, and the maximum number of concurrent connections.

Title: Hosting - Feature
Description:
You can now view usage metrics forHostingin theFirebaseconsole by clicking on theUsagetab. Firebase currently
tracks bytes sent (bandwidth) and total storage used.

Title: the Notifications composer - Feature
Description:
Added pagination to the Notifications summary view, to make
scrolling and viewing of many notification messages easier.

Title: Firebase Test Lab - Feature
Description: Test Labnow includes virtual devices. To learn more, seeTest Your App with Android Virtual Devices.

Title: Documentation - Fixed
Description:
In response to customer feedback, we've made hundreds of small
improvements to theFirebase documentation.

Title: the Notifications composer - Feature
Description:
You can now add more than three custom data fields when sending
a notification. A notification should not exceed 4KB total, including
message text, custom data, and any advanced options.

Title: the Notifications composer - Feature
Description:
Reduced the refresh interval for app versions and language
lists.

Title: the Notifications composer - Feature
Description:
The conversion event counts in the the Notifications composerGoogle Analyticsfunnel view now show the number of users who have
triggered the conversion event at least once. Previously, it showed the raw
number of triggered conversion events.

Title: C++ SDK - Other
Description:
TheFirebaseC++SDK (v1.0.1)is
now available. To install this SDK, seeAdd Firebase to your C++ Project.

Title: Authentication - Fixed
Description:
The Google Play services version 9.0.2 release is now available.
This release fixes aknown issuewithFirebase Authenticationwhere theFirebaseAuthApiis not available on some
devices. AFirebaseApiNotAvailableExceptionerror occurs when those devices
attempt to use Authentication APIs.

Title: Crash Reporting - Fixed
Description:
Updated the Firebase Crash Reporting iOS SDK to fix issues with the
symbol upload script used by Crash Reporting, and also to fix other
miscellaneous issues with this SDK.

Title: Realtime Database - Changed
Description:
The way you install and initialize the SDK has changed and several APIs have
been renamed. When you decide to upgrade, please see theWeb Migration Guide,iOS Migration Guide, orAndroid Migration Guidefor details.

Title: Realtime Database - Changed
Description:
The way you install and initialize the Node.js and Java server SDKs has also
changed. APIs have been renamed and you now authenticate using aservice accountinstead of a secret or custom token. When you choose to upgrade, please see
theDatabase Server SDK Setup Guideand use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you update
your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

Title: Authentication - Changed
Description:
The way you install and initialize the SDK has changed and most APIs have
been renamed. When you decide to upgrade, please see theiOS Migration Guide,Web Migration Guide, orAndroid Migration Guidefor details.

Title: Authentication - Changed
Description:
Node.js / Java server SDKs:Token minting and verificationforFirebase Authenticationis now built into the server SDKs themselves instead of
in separate token minting libraries.All of the existing authentication methods have been removed. Instead,
use thedatabaseAuthVariableOverrideoption (Node.js) orsetDatabaseAuthVariableOverride()method (Java) when initializing the
SDK. Seeherefor more details.Use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you
update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Token minting and verificationforFirebase Authenticationis now built into the server SDKs themselves instead of
in separate token minting libraries.All of the existing authentication methods have been removed. Instead,
use thedatabaseAuthVariableOverrideoption (Node.js) orsetDatabaseAuthVariableOverride()method (Java) when initializing the
SDK. Seeherefor more details.Use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you
update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
All of the existing authentication methods have been removed. Instead,
use thedatabaseAuthVariableOverrideoption (Node.js) orsetDatabaseAuthVariableOverride()method (Java) when initializing the
SDK. Seeherefor more details.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Use theWeb Migration GuideorAndroid Migration Guideto help you
update your Node.js or Java code to the latest APIs.

Title: Authentication - Issue
Description:
General:Limited profile data extracted from federated providers (e.g. doesn’t
include the Twitter username).Workaroundwhere possible, extract this information from the 3rd party
SDKs.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Limited profile data extracted from federated providers (e.g. doesn’t
include the Twitter username).

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Workaroundwhere possible, extract this information from the 3rd party
SDKs.

Title: Authentication - Issue
Description:
Firebase Android SDK:FirebaseUser#linkWithCredential()may invalidate a user's credentials.Description: After callinglinkWithCredential()with a credential
that is not anEmailAuthCredential, sometimes consecutive calls on the
user object may throw an Exception:FirebaseException (An internal error
has occurred. [ TOKEN_EXPIRED ]).WorkaroundCache the credential used on a linking event, and if this
error is thrown, sign the user out after the linking and callFirebaseAuth#signInWithCredential()with the cached credential
afterwards.Missing API to start email verification flow.Some Network exceptions are thrown asFirebaseExceptionrather thanFirebaseNetworkException.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
FirebaseUser#linkWithCredential()may invalidate a user's credentials.Description: After callinglinkWithCredential()with a credential
that is not anEmailAuthCredential, sometimes consecutive calls on the
user object may throw an Exception:FirebaseException (An internal error
has occurred. [ TOKEN_EXPIRED ]).WorkaroundCache the credential used on a linking event, and if this
error is thrown, sign the user out after the linking and callFirebaseAuth#signInWithCredential()with the cached credential
afterwards.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Description: After callinglinkWithCredential()with a credential
that is not anEmailAuthCredential, sometimes consecutive calls on the
user object may throw an Exception:FirebaseException (An internal error
has occurred. [ TOKEN_EXPIRED ]).

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
WorkaroundCache the credential used on a linking event, and if this
error is thrown, sign the user out after the linking and callFirebaseAuth#signInWithCredential()with the cached credential
afterwards.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description: Missing API to start email verification flow.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description: Some Network exceptions are thrown asFirebaseExceptionrather thanFirebaseNetworkException.

Title: Authentication - Issue
Description:
FirebaseSDK forAppleplatforms:sendPasswordResetWithEmail:completion:does not call the completion
handler in the main thread as claimed.Workaround:Objective-C[[FIRAuthauth]sendPasswordResetWithEmail:@"user@host.domain"completion:^(NSError*_Nullableerror){dispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue(),^{// original completion handler code.});}];SwiftFIRAuth.auth()?.sendPasswordResetWithEmail("user@host.domain"){errorindispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue()){//originalcompletionhandlercode.}}API reference docs do not contain information about error conditions:
see themhere.Authentication state is shared between different apps when running on.
the iOS Simulator:Description: when running two or more applications
that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue
with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared
across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to
an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed
in into it.Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the
applications between tests.FirebaseJavaScriptSDK:If you change the authdomain configuration of an app while some users are
signed in, you have to sign them out and in again in order to use
linkWithPopup/Redirect APIsDoes not work in Safari private browsing mode.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
sendPasswordResetWithEmail:completion:does not call the completion
handler in the main thread as claimed.Workaround:Objective-C[[FIRAuthauth]sendPasswordResetWithEmail:@"user@host.domain"completion:^(NSError*_Nullableerror){dispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue(),^{// original completion handler code.});}];SwiftFIRAuth.auth()?.sendPasswordResetWithEmail("user@host.domain"){errorindispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue()){//originalcompletionhandlercode.}}API reference docs do not contain information about error conditions:
see themhere.Authentication state is shared between different apps when running on.
the iOS Simulator:Description: when running two or more applications
that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue
with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared
across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to
an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed
in into it.Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the
applications between tests.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description: Workaround:Objective-C[[FIRAuthauth]sendPasswordResetWithEmail:@"user@host.domain"completion:^(NSError*_Nullableerror){dispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue(),^{// original completion handler code.});}];SwiftFIRAuth.auth()?.sendPasswordResetWithEmail("user@host.domain"){errorindispatch_async(dispatch_get_main_queue()){//originalcompletionhandlercode.}}

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
API reference docs do not contain information about error conditions:
see themhere.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Authentication state is shared between different apps when running on.
the iOS Simulator:Description: when running two or more applications
that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue
with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared
across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to
an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed
in into it.Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the
applications between tests.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Description: when running two or more applications
that useFirebase Authenticationon the same iOS simulator, there is a issue
with the iOS keychain that causes the authentication state to be shared
across the different applications. This means that if you sign in to
an app, and later open a second app, you may find a user to be signed
in into it.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
Workaround: either don't use two different applications withAuthenticationon the same simulator instance, or manually sign out from the
applications between tests.

Title: Authentication - Issue
Description:
FirebaseJavaScriptSDK:If you change the authdomain configuration of an app while some users are
signed in, you have to sign them out and in again in order to use
linkWithPopup/Redirect APIsDoes not work in Safari private browsing mode.

Title: Authentication - Other
Description:
If you change the authdomain configuration of an app while some users are
signed in, you have to sign them out and in again in order to use
linkWithPopup/Redirect APIs

Title: Authentication - Other
Description: Does not work in Safari private browsing mode.

Title: Cloud Storage - Feature
Description:
Initial release ofCloud Storage.Cloud Storageprovides
secure file uploads and downloads for your Firebase apps, regardless of
network quality. You can use it to store images, audio, video, or other
user-generated content. Firebase Storage is backed byGoogle Cloud Storage, a powerful, simple,
and cost-effective object storage service.

Title: Cloud Storage - Issue
Description: Firebaseconsole: Only project owners can updateFirebase Security RulesforCloud Storage, and only owners and editors can viewCloud StorageSecurity Rules.

Title: FCM - Feature
Description: Initial release ofCloud Messaging.

Title: FCM - Issue
Description:
FirebaseC++SDK:Messages with both a notification and data payload are not delivered to
an Android application open in the background.Description:On Android, when the app is open in the background and it
receives a message with both a notification and data payload, the message
is not delivered to the application.Workaround:In the application's activity, (e.g.NativeActivity),
override theonNewIntent(Intent intent)method and pass theintentargument through to the methodsetIntent(Intent intent)For example:publicclassMyActivityextendsNativeActivity{@OverrideonNewIntent(Intentintent){setIntent(intent);}}Seethe quickstart samplefor an example of this workaround in action.

Title: FCM - Other
Description:
Messages with both a notification and data payload are not delivered to
an Android application open in the background.

Title: FCM - Other
Description:
Description:On Android, when the app is open in the background and it
receives a message with both a notification and data payload, the message
is not delivered to the application.

Title: FCM - Other
Description:
Workaround:In the application's activity, (e.g.NativeActivity),
override theonNewIntent(Intent intent)method and pass theintentargument through to the methodsetIntent(Intent intent)For example:publicclassMyActivityextendsNativeActivity{@OverrideonNewIntent(Intentintent){setIntent(intent);}}Seethe quickstart samplefor an example of this workaround in action.

Title: FCM - Other
Description: For example:publicclassMyActivityextendsNativeActivity{@OverrideonNewIntent(Intentintent){setIntent(intent);}}Seethe quickstart samplefor an example of this workaround in action.
